basics.name: Wassim Ben Youssef
basics.label: Data Scientist, ML and AI Engineer

work.name: Artefact MENA
work.summary: Artefact MENA is a data consultancy company aiding corporations in their digital transformation initiatives. I worked on developing and implementing the roadmap for data strategy for an asset management company. I Led data analysis and machine learning projects for clients in the construction, real estate, and hospitality sectors.
highlights: Managed a team of 3 data analysts and data scientists.
Developed a clustering-based approach to estimate the cost of future construction projects.
Built machine learning models to forecast the occupancy rate of golf courses.
Built P&L reporting dashboards for Golf and Hospitality sectors.

work.name: Xelix
work.summary: Xelix is a SaaS company that helps identify errors and frauds in invoices using AI bolted onto the clients finance systems . I joined as the first Data Scientist and automated the invoice error and fraud detection process, saving millions of £ to our customers.
highlights: Developed ML models to identify errors and frauds in invoice fields.
Trained model to identify invoices associated with incorrect vendors.
Implement an AI system with a combination of rule-based algorithms and ML models to detect duplicated invoices.
Implemented scalable production code to process millions of invoices
Designed and implemented the monitoring and retraining lifecycle of models

work.name: Digital Fineprint
work.summary: Digital Fineprint is an award-winning insurtech company that assists the insurance community in engaging and understanding SME clients. I joined the company as the first data scientist to build a SaaS product that uses all available open source data to provide insightful information about SMEs to our insurance clients.
highlights: Developed ML models to identify errors and frauds in invoice fields.
Trained model to identify invoices associated with incorrect vendors.
Implement an AI system with a combination of rule-based algorithms and ML models to detect duplicated invoices.
Implemented scalable production code to process millions of invoices
Designed and implemented the monitoring and retraining lifecycle of models

teaching.summary:
Authoring an online course of 4 hours about Advanced Machine Learning for Business Professionals. Creating
all the content and the slides and recording the videos.
highlights: Average of 5-star on 81 reviews

teaching.summary: Worked as a teacher for a data science bootcamp provided by Le Wagon. Coached and helped students to learn all the technical skills for a successfull data science career.
highlights: Python coding
Machine Learning
Data Analysis
Data Engineering

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Quantum Teleportation
Quantum Cryptography
